events.title: Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo Signed
events.description: The treaty was signed, ending the Mexican-American War. Mexico ceded large parts of its territory to the United States, including present-day California, Nevada, Utah, Arizona, and parts of several other states.
events.significance: This treaty vastly expanded U.S. territory and significantly impacted the relationship between the U.S. and Mexico.

events.title: Battle of Stalingrad Ends
events.description: The German 6th Army surrendered to Soviet forces after months of brutal fighting during World War II.
events.significance: The defeat marked a turning point in the war on the Eastern Front, shifting the momentum in favor of the Allies.

events.title: Discovery of King Tutankhamun's Tomb
events.description: British archaeologist Howard Carter discovered the entrance to King Tutankhamun's tomb in the Valley of the Kings, Egypt.
events.significance: The discovery was one of the most significant archaeological finds, offering invaluable insights into ancient Egyptian culture and history.

events.title: Battle of Poltava
events.description: Peter the Great of Russia defeated the Swedish army under Charles XII, marking the end of Sweden's status as a great power in Europe.
events.significance: The battle established Russia as a dominant power in Eastern Europe and shifted the balance of power in the region.
